712715f-a.text:
41st Street, north side, west from but not including Third Avenue,

712716f-a.text:
East 4lst Street, south side, east from, but not including Third Ave.,
to the East River. Note Tudor City in the background.
October 9, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.

712717f-a.text:
E. 41st Street, east from Third Avenue (foreground) to the East River as seen from the 12th Floor of an office building on Lexington Avenue between 40th and 41st Streets. Note that at this date only one unit of Tudor City stands, same being the 42nd 43rd Street building. Subsequently several others will rise and that latter date will see the huge News Bldg. in the left foreground.
August 30, 1927.
P.L. Sperr

712719f-a.text:
216 East 41st Street, south side, east of Third Avenue. This is a two-story frame house with a stucco front.
1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 538
